studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1.1 Synopsis / Section 3 Objectives and Endpoints
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Key secondary objective at 20 weeks modified from by dose to pooled dose analysis for 10 mg and 15 mg doses

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1.1 Synopsis / Section 3 Objectives and Endpoints
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Key secondary objective at 72 weeks modified - added endpoint for ≥20% body weight reduction from randomization

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1.1 Synopsis / Section 3 Objectives and Endpoints
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: SF-36v2 acute form Physical Functioning domain score objective moved from by dose to pooled dose analysis
Added guidance for definition of incident diabetes, retesting, confirmation, recording, and adjudication
Added allowance for dose modification for management of participants with perceived excessive weight loss during additional 2-year treatment period

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 6.6.3 Management of Participants with Perceived Excessive Weight Loss
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added new subsection for managing participants with perceived excessive weight loss during additional 2-year treatment period

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 7.2 Participant Discontinuation/Withdrawal from the Study
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added requirement for female participants to be withdrawn if they become pregnant
Updated to reflect changes in key secondary objectives and endpoints
Updated information on estimands and related analyses to address FDA feedback
Updated to reflect changes in key objectives and endpoints

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 9.4.4.4.2 Events Related to Potential Abuse Liability
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated abuse liability event identification to use narrow terms from SMQ of Drug abuse and dependence
Added wording for adjudication of incident diabetes events with cross-reference to Section 4.1.2.3

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 10.4 Appendix 4 Contraceptive Guidance and Collection of Pregnancy Information
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Modified to indicate pregnant participants will discontinue study intervention and be withdrawn from study

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 10.7 Appendix 7 Protocol GPHK Standardized Protocols
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Added note that venous cannula may not be required for 2-hour OGTT repeat to confirm diabetes diagnosis
Standardized terminology for additional 2-year treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Update key study objectives and endpoints, clarify incident diabetes definition, add guidance for dose modification during additional 2-year treatment period, and update statistical analyses to align with SAP
Analysis of pooled data from participants on different tirzepatide doses is more appropriate as participants randomized to the 15-mg dose will not be exposed to that dose until after Week 20
To better inform clinical decisions in management of people living with obesity
To support patient management and retention in the additional 2-year treatment period
To address and align with FDA feedback

Based on mechanism of action of tirzepatide, anticipated gastrointestinal adverse events, and low likelihood for abuse potential/psychoactive effects, it is reasonable to narrow the list of abuse terms used

studyChanges.beforeText: Key secondary objective at 20 weeks by dose analysis
studyChanges.afterText: Key secondary objective at 20 weeks pooled dose analysis reflecting pooled 10 mg and 15 mg doses
studyChanges.summary: Changed 20-week key secondary objective from by dose to pooled dose analysis
Added new endpoint for ≥20% body weight reduction at 72 weeks

studyChanges.beforeText: SF-36v2 acute form Physical Functioning domain score for 10 mg and 15 mg separately in Key secondary at 72 weeks by dose analysis
studyChanges.afterText: SF-36v2 acute form Physical Functioning domain score moved to Key secondary at 72 weeks pooled dose analysis
studyChanges.summary: Moved SF-36v2 Physical Functioning objective from by dose to pooled dose analysis

studyChanges.afterText: Guidance for retesting, confirmation, recording, and adjudication of incident diabetes
studyChanges.summary: Added comprehensive guidance for incident diabetes definition and management

studyChanges.afterText: Sentence allowing dose modification for management of participants with perceived excessive weight loss during the additional 2-year treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization
studyChanges.summary: Added allowance for dose modification for excessive weight loss management

studyChanges.afterText: New subsection containing information for managing participants with perceived excessive weight loss during the additional 2-year treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization
studyChanges.summary: Added new subsection for managing excessive weight loss

studyChanges.afterText: Female participants will be withdrawn from the study if the participant becomes pregnant
studyChanges.summary: Added bullet point requiring withdrawal of pregnant participants

studyChanges.afterText: Updated information on estimands and related analyses
studyChanges.summary: Updated primary analyses to address FDA feedback on estimands

studyChanges.beforeText: Previous abuse liability event identification terms
studyChanges.afterText: To identify AE terms suggestive of potential abuse liability, narrow terms from SMQ of Drug abuse and dependence (20000101) will be used
studyChanges.summary: Narrowed abuse liability event identification to specific SMQ terms

studyChanges.beforeText: If a study participant becomes pregnant, the participant will discontinue study intervention
studyChanges.afterText: If a study participant becomes pregnant, the participant will discontinue study intervention and will be withdrawn from the study
studyChanges.summary: Clarified that pregnant participants must both discontinue intervention and withdraw from study

studyChanges.afterText: Note stating that placement of a venous cannula may not be required when a 2-hour OGTT is repeated to confirm the diagnosis of diabetes during the study, and only samples at 0 and 120 minutes for glucose measurement will be collected
studyChanges.summary: Added note clarifying OGTT procedure for diabetes confirmation

studyChanges.beforeText: Various inconsistent terms for study period following primary outcome at Visit 21 (Week 72)
studyChanges.afterText: Additional 2-year treatment period for participants with prediabetes at randomization
studyChanges.summary: Standardized terminology for the additional 2-year treatment period
